p: In general terms, the tested fungal isolates showed a variable degree of sensitivity patterns to the selected essential oils. The Minimal Inhibitory Concentrations (MIC) ranged from 0.04 to 2 mg·mL −1. It was found that A. terreus and M. canis molds were moderately sensitive to all tested samples exhibiting a MIC value of 0.4 mg·mL −1. It is relevant to note that the CNG 1 essential oil was considerably able to inhibit the fungal growth rate of T. mentagrophytes dermatophyte (MIC = 0.04 mg·mL −1).
